intro: Campnosperma acutiauris, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, with small, elongated leaflets that give it a feathery appearance. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
